The UIA, or Unconventional Investigation Agency, was formed on the second day of December 1902 under the orders of then commander in chief Theodore Roosevelt. It's duty was to investigate and dispose of any and all potential paranormal threats to the United States of America and its interests. Due to the delicate nature of their assignments they had free reign over their own assignments, as well as the funds allocated to them. However, after years of coming up empty they became the laughing stock of Agencies. As time passed funding was drastically cut to the agency and it became a sort of punishment and receptacle for the failures and screw ups of the other Agencies. It was a place where careers went to die. However, not all agents were saddened by the prospect, there were indeed some who willingly came to the agency. With images of the X-Files and the Men In Black running through their heads, they expected mystery and danger. Instead they got goose chases and paper work. Though this didn't sap the the fervor of all the Agents.

It does however have it's uses, such as being used as a training ground for newer Agents.

A new case however is blowing life back into the UIA. A strange rash of disappearances has broken out across the country, with young women disappearing without a trace. Originally it had been thought to be a serial killer, but it was all too sterile, too eerily clean. After the other agencies came up with nothing it was relegated to the UIA.

If the Agency could solve this they could be back on the map.

Martin Olson - Remember that mention about starry eyed recruits daydreaming of the X-Files and the Men In Black? Martin is one of them, though he has yet to lose his faith. Convinced that the Agency is simply keeping the truth under wraps from such a low level agent, Martin sees a conspiracy everywhere, and loves it. She said in more of a question than a statement. "Well I can, but there's a price to everything." Nathan told her, sweet as honey. "What would you want for a handle of vodka?" She asked, once again looking around to make sure no one was around. Nathan thought about it a moment, "Well how about a go at that sweet little butt of yours honey?" The girl's eyes grew round, "M-my butt? I can't do that!" She quietly exclaimed. Nathan put a sad look on his face, "Well I guess I can't help ya then." He told her, putting his keys back on his belt. He slowly started to walk back to the door, and halfway there he knew he had her. He heard her hurrying along behind him, "A-alright, I'll do it" She whispered, and Nathan just grinned. As he led the girl to his office in the secluded cellar section of the school all he could think was, business was good today.
